ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral serous effusion
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Supported by mild flat hearing loss, Type B tympanograms, low static compliance, absent reflexes, and absent TEOAEs. Lack of fever or pain suggests effusion rather than active infection.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Conductive hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: ABR shows prolonged absolute latencies with normal interpeak latencies, confirming conductive pathology consistent with middle ear fluid.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine hearing thresholds and configuration of loss.
To cross-check pure-tone thresholds (SRT) and assess recognition (SRS).
To assess middle ear function and tympanic membrane mobility.
To evaluate the acoustic reflex arc and support differential diagnosis.
To differentiate between conductive and sensorineural pathology given limited behavioral data.
To assess cochlear outer hair cell function.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Results indicate a mild, flat bilateral conductive hearing loss. Pure-tone averages and SRTs are consistent (20-25 dB HL). Middle ear pathology is confirmed by Type B tympanograms with low static compliance, absent acoustic reflexes, and absent TEOAEs. ABR latency patterns (prolonged waves, normal interpeaks) further confirm the conductive nature, likely due to bilateral serous effusion.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Mild, flat hearing loss bilaterally. Right thresholds ~20 dB HL; Left thresholds ~25-30 dB HL (500-4000 Hz). Bone conduction not obtained.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT Right 20 dB HL, Left 25 dB HL. SRS not obtained.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Type B (flat) bilaterally with low static compliance (Right 0.25 cc, Left 0.20 cc).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent ipsilateral and contralateral reflexes bilaterally.

tests.name: ABR
tests.result_summary: All waves prolonged; interpeak latencies normal; latency-intensity function normal. Consistent with conductive pathology.

proposed_items: Request a report of the physician's findings.
Make an appointment for further audiometric study, especially bone conduction.
Complete audiometric examination after all medical and/or surgical treatment is completed.
Consider referral to a speech-language pathologist if language delay persists after hearing normalizes.
Suggest the father consider a hearing evaluation for his own hearing issues.
counseling_actions: Explain that findings suggest fluid in the middle ear (serous effusion) causing mild hearing loss.
Clarify that the hearing loss explains the child's inattention and 'huh' behavior.
Stress the importance of a complete audiometric exam after medical treatment to ensure hearing returns to normal.

escalation.rationale_short: Refer for medical evaluation and treatment of bilateral serous effusion.

follow_up_plan.timeline: After all medical and/or surgical treatment has been completed
follow_up_plan.objective: Complete audiometric examination, including bone conduction, to confirm hearing has returned to normal.
